title: Firefox loses all preferences and configurations after computer restarts
content:
Every time I restart my laptop, Firefox loses all preferences and configurations whenever I reboot my laptop.

When I open Firefox after restarting my laptop, it acts as it's not connected to the internet, and won't load any pages, it just keeps loading indefinitely.

It's still connected to my Mozilla Account, but Sync is turned off, and all configurations and customization seem to be reset to default.

To fix the "connection" issue, I go to Menu > Help > More troubleshooting information and select the Refresh Firefox... button.

After that, I can go and activate the Sync option again, which will get all my bookmarks, extensions, etc.

Finally, I go to about:config and change the value of browser.uiCustomization.state to set my toolbar customization as I normally use.

I've tried reinstalling Firefox, removing all Mozilla-related files and folders, removed registry entries, but nothing worked...

I really enjoy Firefox, but this is too much of a headache... This is my last attempt to solve this issue, or I'll be forced to switch to another browser... At this point, even Internet Explorer will do


Firefox v131.0.3 running on a x64 Windows 11
creator: artur.donda

Help!!!!

title: Firefox tab RAM usage increases over time when repeatedly changing an image's "src"
content:
Hi, Not sure if this is the right place but here goes:

Firefox keeps increasing it's tab RAM usage when I change the "src" property of an image programmatically for extended periods of time (1 hour or so).

I created a dummy project here: https://github.com/mvandermade/example-base64-image-memory-high-native

The code above swaps out the image "src" 20 times a second. However I seen buildups with lower frequencies but bigger images too...

Here some measurement of tab RAM usage:

Measurements Windows 10: Firefox 131 00.00h 37MB 01.15h 127MB 03.00h 228MB

Edge (latest) 00.00h 28MB 01.15h 30MB 03.00h 33MB

(Edge seems to have no memory buildup as much)

Here is a copy of the code if the repo ever goes down: ``` <script> function generateRandomBase64Image() { // Create a canvas element const canvas = document.createElement('canvas'); const ctx = canvas.getContext('2d'); // Set canvas dimensions canvas.width = 200; canvas.height = 200; if(ctx == null) return "" // Fill the canvas with a random color ctx.fillStyle = `#${Math.floor(Math.random() * 16777215).toString(16)}`; ctx.fillRect(0, 0, canvas.width, canvas.height); // Draw some random shapes for (let i = 0; i < 10; i++) { ctx.fillStyle = `#${Math.floor(Math.random() * 16777215).toString(16)}`; ctx.beginPath(); ctx.arc( Math.random() * canvas.width, Math.random() * canvas.height, Math.random() * 50, 0, Math.PI * 2 ); ctx.fill(); } // Convert the canvas to a Base64 string return canvas.toDataURL('image/png'); } setInterval(() => { document.getElementById("swapper").src=generateRandomBase64Image() }, 50) </script> ```

Just a observation from my side, if I can help improve things please let me know!

Greetings,

Martijn

p.s. I also created a project in React which gives similar results: https://github.com/mvandermade/example-base64-image-memory-high
creator: martijn.vandermade

title: Controlling the digital data input field with the mouse wheel
content:
Hello.

My problem is that in new versions of Firefox (from 115) there is no way to enter numeric values ​​using the mouse wheel. The browser simply scrolls the entire page. In older versions this problem does not exist.

I tried to compare the settings about:config but did not succeed. There must be some parameter responsible for this.

In fact, they force you to update by deprecating certificates, but it is becoming more and more difficult to use :(


I'm attaching a screenshot. It should be: When you scroll the mouse wheel, the numbers change (like in older versions) It is in fact (Scrolling the entire page and the numbers need to be entered on the keyboard)

I hope I explained clearly what is needed.

Thank you in advance

title: Firefox update issue
content: Went into Firefox and got the error message: Platform version 131.03 is not compatible with min version>=131.02 & max version>=131.02 So I'm thinking that the last update caused the error. I did a system restore to a week earlier, and after 5 hours, the computer rebooted to that date. Upon opening Firefox, I found the the notice that the next time Firefox opens, it will update. After closing, and reopening, Firefox updated and displayed the same error message. Nor quite sure what to do, I downloaded Firefox again, and was going to uninstall and reinstall. But as soon as the download finished, it loaded. So now I have the new Firefox without all of my saved bookmarks and passwords. I thought I'd read someplace that that wouldn't happen, and all of my password and bookmark history would transfer to the new Firefox. As if that wasn't enough to ruin my day, I found that the new Firefox isn't working in my wife's account on the same computer. She gets the same error message as I did before the new install. I know, my fault for not backing up the bookmark and password files, but what's my option now?

title: How to change menu font in version 132
content:
I haven't upgraded browser versions for a while and I'm now going from 109 to 132. Pretty bad I know.

I'm having a number of issues but for this post I'd like to concentrate on userChrome.css.

In version 109, I had a custom font for the top menu bar, the top menus, the bookmark toolbar, the bookmark toolbar menus, and the right click menus. I did this by including the following in userChrome.css (as per [https://support.mozilla.org/si/questi.../1335097|here]:

  1. navigator-toolbox { font-family:"MyFont" !important }

This worked great, but it is no longer working in version 132. Obviously I don't know in which Firefox version this stopped working.

Has this been disabled by Mozilla or has it been changed? If it's been changed, how can I achieve it now?

I'm very grateful for any help!
creator: BlohoJo

title: Browser often crashes or lags when accessing Google services
content:
Firefox crashes when trying to log in or add an account on Google services. It will also sometimes lag or not load when searching or trying to access Google Maps etc.

The first part happens whenever a website has a login with Google option, or if I attempt to go to accounts.google.com and do it there. As soon as I start typing in the input box it hangs after a letter or 2. I can reproduce this hang consistently. When it crashes, there is a URL in the bottom left indicating the browser is trying to access something.

I've cleared my cache and cookies and the problem remains. In addition, the Firefox crash reporter is empty and hasn't registered any crashes, even though it has clearly hanged and is visible in Windows Event Viewer (attached). This only happens on Google pages, so any help would be appreciated as obviously I switched from Chrome for better performance but I still need to access their services.
creator: ssvhyp

title: Firefox doesn't honor cursor theme after update
content:
I run Debian stable (version 12.7) and the Blackbox window manager. After the latest update to Firefox 128.3.1esr (with apt dist-upgrade) the cursor is black in Firefox windows but white elsewhere. My ~/.Xresources contains the line

Xcursor.theme: DMZ-White

which Firefox obviously doesn't use now. I have tried to set the theme with

gsettings set org.gnome.desktop.interface cursor-theme 'DMZ-White'

but that didn't change anything. Any clues?

title: redirect that I can't clear
content:
On my website www.peacetogether.co.uk I have convertbox pop ups for offers and freebies which has been fine until recently when ONLY in firefox (not FF incognito, or chrome) it re-directs WITHOUT me clicking anything to a corrupt / mistyped url - https://https//peacetogether.thrivecart.com/pop-up-replay/

If I clear cache and cookies on the site it clears it temporarily - but I really want a way to deal with it permanently!

I've edited the pop-ups so they are correct and they work on every other browser I've tried so it much be something saved on my firefox.

I've done the firefox refresh... I've taken FF off and redownloaded it... what else can I do - it's drving me nuts!?

I've also got problems with my Trello through FF since the last update but that's another matter.

title: Firefox Defaulting Link Clicks to Google Searches
content:
Today, something has changed in my Firefox browser. When I click on a link in my gmail inbox, it opens a new tab, as would be expected. But, the browser commits a google search to that link... this breaks the link! I have turned off Google as the default browser in settings, but still no luck.

Example: Link in gmail: https://accounts.firefox.com Link created in new browser tab: https://www.google.com/url?q=https://accounts.firefox.com

title: Firefox freezes whole computer, can only do hard shutdown and restart
content:
Windows 11 FF 131.0.3 64-bit

This has been an intermittent problem since the update before this one. The screen freezes and nothing works, no mouse, no keypad, nothing. Ctrl-Alt-Delete doesn't even work. There is no way to shut it down except the power button. It happens at different times, and doesn't seen to have one trigger. I've run troubleshooter, but no change.

It was happening in the previous update, but it seems worse in this one. I asked about this on Reddit a few weeks ago, and someone else said he was having the same problem.
creator: dsa65

title: Slow rendering time and laggy load times
content:
Hi there,

Hope this message finds you well.

I am presently having trouble loading websites and speed times are very slow.

Been using firefox for 7 years and never had an issue on linux versions. Though on macos I seem to be having these slow load times.

Also rendering images and content takes quite a while to do this.


I am currently running Firefox 131.0.3 (aarch64)

This is on a iMac m3 running Macos sonoma 14.6.1

I have compared this with safari and chrome and it seems to be much better.

Is there a test I can run to see if everything is okay?

thanks for making the best browser ever!

Best always

Benji

title: Sync re-adds bookmarks everytime i add a device or reinstall Firefox?
content: I've added Firefox to multiple PCs and phones in the past. I just upgraded my PC and had to reinstall Windows so I also had to reinstall Firefox. It seems like everytime I install Firefox on a new device or reinstall it it keeps re-adding my bookmarks. My bookmarks menu is now like 400 bookmarks long, most of which are duplicate bookmarks or bookmarks that I deleted long ago. How can i stop this from happening and how can I get rid of all these duplicate bookmarks without having to delete them one at a time?

title: The number of commercial websites not supporting FF is increasing....Does FF have any plans?
content:

On one of them (PG&E), FF is useless. Can't even log in.

On the two others, banners come up that say FF is unsupported. Both still usable for the moment, But the future....

I fear FF is going to become unusable/irrelevant in my work-flow in the near-term future if the trend in my skewed sample continues.
creator: jeffb4

title: On Mac, when FF is idle for a few minutes, its widow disappears...
content:
On Mac, when FF is idle for a few minutes, its widow disappears...

Often happens also on "main" screen (laptop) intermittently.

To bring back I have to click on the FF icon on the Mac LaunchPad.

Have tried playing with hardware acceleration off/on and setting up "separate spaces" for monitor and "main" screen. None work.

Found an app to generate clicks periodically at the (x,y) of the FF icon on the LaunchPad, but such is mickey-mouse and not really acceptable.

A few versions back (sorry, can't saw how far back), the above was not a problem.


I did file a bug on Bugzilla, but have seen any acknowledgment. Similar problems are recorded on the 'net.
creator: jeffb4

title: Firefox demora muito para iniciar
content: Toda vez que eu fecho o firefox ou reinicio o computador, quando abro novamente o mozilla ele fica absurdamente lento e demora muito pra carregar as primeiras páginas. Até para carregar o google ele chega a demorar mais de 10 minutos. Depois dessa demora inicial, ele volta a funcionar normalmente. A questão é que esse problema parece ser comum e já vi em outros fóruns soluções como "restaure o firefox", "desligue todas as extensões" ou "limpe seu histórico e os cookies" para que o mozilla volte a funcionar normalmente. E isso realmente funciona para resolver essa demora inicial, mas quando eu fechar o navegador e abrir de novo outro dia, o problema vai acontecer de novo. Não pretendo desinstalar minhas extensões (não uso nada muito complexo, apenas bloqueadores de anúncios e detectores de música) nem pretendo restaurar o firefox toda vez que quiser usar, então pergunto: existe algum jeito de resolver este problema da demora inicial de uma vez por todas? Ou só existem paliativos? Realmente não queria trocar de navegador.
creator: leo.jardim
